original: dgos pa yod par bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa rnam pa gsum gyi gnyen por rim pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: They are taught in order as antidotes to the three types of clinging to the perishable collection.

original: mu stegs pa bdag tu 'dzin pa rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: mu stegs pa bdag tu 'dzin pa rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: There are three kinds of tīrthika self-habits.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa rnam pa gsum spang bar bya ba'i gnyen po phung po dang skye mched dang khams rim bzhin du bshad de de ni dgos pa'o //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa rnam pa gsum spang bar bya ba'i gnyen po phung po dang skye mched dang khams rim bzhin du bshad de de ni dgos pa'o //
translated: The purpose is that the aggregates, bases, and constituents are explained in order as antidotes to the three kinds of self-habits to be abandoned.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa rnam pa gsum po yang gang yin mi shes nas gsum po de gang yin bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa rnam pa gsum po yang gang yin mi shes nas gsum po de gang yin bstan par bya ba'i phyir /

analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa rnam pa gsum ni gcig tu 'dzin pa dang / za bar byed pa dang byed par 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: it says, “The three kinds of self-habits are the habit of apprehending as one, the habit of apprehending as a consumer, and the habit of apprehending as an agent.”

original: de gcig tu 'dzin par byed pa'i gnyen por ni phung po lnga bshad de /
analyzed: de gcig tu 'dzin par byed pa'i gnyen por ni phung po lnga bshad de /
translated: The antidote to the habit of apprehending as one is the explanation of the five aggregates.

original: phung po lnga'i rang bzhin bshes na gcig tu 'dzin pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phung po lnga'i rang bzhin bshes na gcig tu 'dzin pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one knows the nature of the five aggregates, the habit of apprehending as one is eliminated.

original: bra bar 'dzin pa'i gnyen por skye mched bcu gnyis bshad de /
analyzed: bra bar 'dzin pa'i gnyen por skye mched bcu gnyis bshad de /
translated: The antidote to the habit of apprehending as a consumer is the explanation of the twelve bases.

analyzed: skye mched bcu gnyis kyi rang bzhin shes na za bar 'dzin pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one knows the nature of the twelve bases, the habit of apprehending as a consumer is eliminated.

original: byed par 'dzin pa'i gnyen por khams bco brgyad bshad de /
analyzed: byed par 'dzin pa'i gnyen por khams bco brgyad bshad de /
translated: The antidote to the apprehension of an agent is the teaching of the eighteen constituents.

original: khams bco brgyad kyi rang bzhin shes na byed par 'dzin pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khams bco brgyad kyi rang bzhin shes na byed par 'dzin pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one knows the nature of the eighteen constituents, the apprehension of an agent will be eliminated.

analyzed: de la bdag tu smra ba bye brag pa dang grangs can la sogs pa ni chos mang po 'dus pa mi rtag pa'i phung po 'di la bdag gcig pur 'dzin to //

original: dge ba la sogs pa'i las kyang bdag des mngon par 'du byed /
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa'i las kyang bdag des mngon par 'du byed /
translated: The self creates virtuous and so on karma.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rnam par shes pa yang bdag des shes par @128a * //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rnam par shes pa yang bdag des shes par @128a * //
translated: The nature of form and so on is consciousness.🔽

original: byed de / bdag de ni gcig bu rtag pa'o zhes gcig tu 'dzin to //
analyzed: byed de / bdag de ni gcig bu rtag pa'o zhes gcig tu 'dzin to //
translated: The nature of form, etc. is also known by consciousness, and that self is held to be one and permanent.

original: de'i lan du sems can rnams kyi lus kyi dngos po lnga las ma gtogs par gzugs la sogs pa la mthong bar bya ba'i bdag gcig bu ba'i rang bzhin ni gang yang med do //
analyzed: de'i lan du sems can rnams kyi lus kyi dngos po lnga las ma gtogs par gzugs la sogs pa la mthong bar bya ba'i bdag gcig bu ba'i rang bzhin ni gang yang med do //
translated: In response to that, apart from the five entities of sentient beings’ bodies, there is no self at all that is one and permanent and is seen in form, etc.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs ni mig nyid kyis mthong bar byed par zad kyi mig las ma gtogs par mthong bar byed pa'i bdag gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: gzugs ni mig nyid kyis mthong bar byed par zad kyi mig las ma gtogs par mthong bar byed pa'i bdag gzhan ni med do //
translated: The eye itself sees form, but apart from the eye, there is no other self that sees.

original: de bzhin du sgra la sogs pa yang rna ba la sogs pa nyid kyis thos par byed do zhes bya bar sbyor ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra la sogs pa yang rna ba la sogs pa nyid kyis thos par byed do zhes bya bar sbyor ro //
translated: Similarly, the ear itself hears sound, and so on.

original: gzhan gyis brgal ba /
analyzed: gzhan gyis brgal ba /
translated: Another objection:

original: mig las ma gtogs pa'i bdag mthong bar byed ba med kyi mig nyid kyis mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad na mig ni rdul phran las gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: mig las ma gtogs pa'i bdag mthong bar byed ba med kyi mig nyid kyis mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad na mig ni rdul phran las gyur ba yin te /
translated: If it is said that the self is not seen apart from the eye, but the eye itself sees, the eye is composed of atoms.

original: blun po'i rang bzhin yin na des ji ltar gzugs mthong bar byed /
analyzed: blun po'i rang bzhin yin na des ji ltar gzugs mthong bar byed /
translated: If it has the nature of being stupid, how can it see form?

original: lan du / gzugs ni mig gi rnam par shes pas mthong ba ste /
analyzed: lan du / gzugs ni mig gi rnam par shes pas mthong ba ste /
translated: The response is that form is seen by the eye consciousness.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pas gzugs mthong ba'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa mig gi dbang pos byed pas mig gi rnam par shes pas mthong yang mig gis mthong ngo zhes btags so //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pas gzugs mthong ba'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa mig gi dbang pos byed pas mig gi rnam par shes pas mthong yang mig gis mthong ngo zhes btags so //
translated: The eye faculty is the uncommon cause of the eye consciousness seeing form. Therefore, although the eye consciousness sees, it is designated as the eye seeing.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba'i phung po nyid myong bar byed pa'i rang bzhin yin pas tshor ba'i phung po nyid kyis tshor zhing myong bar byed par zad kyi tshor ba myong bar byed pa'i bdag gzhan med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba'i phung po nyid myong bar byed pa'i rang bzhin yin pas tshor ba'i phung po nyid kyis tshor zhing myong bar byed par zad kyi tshor ba myong bar byed pa'i bdag gzhan med do //
translated: Similarly, since the aggregate of feeling has the nature of experience, the aggregate of feeling itself feels and experiences. There is no other self that feels the feeling.

original: 'du shes kyang yul la mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid yin pas yul gyi mtshan ma yang 'du shes nyid kyis 'dzin gyi bdag gcig pu med do //
analyzed: 'du shes kyang yul la mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid yin pas yul gyi mtshan ma yang 'du shes nyid kyis 'dzin gyi bdag gcig pu med do //
translated: And since ideation has the nature of apprehending the signs of an object, the signs of an object are also apprehended by ideation itself, not by a single self.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la yang sbyor ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la yang sbyor ro //
translated: The same is to be applied to consciousness, etc.

original: de bzhin du 'du byed kyang las dge ba dang mi dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa yin pas las dge ba dang mi dge ba yang 'du byed kyis byed par zad kyi bdag gcig pu des las dge ba dang mi dge ba byed pa ma yin no
analyzed: de bzhin du 'du byed kyang las dge ba dang mi dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa yin pas las dge ba dang mi dge ba yang 'du byed kyis byed par zad kyi bdag gcig pu des las dge ba dang mi dge ba byed pa ma yin no
translated: Similarly, since formative predispositions are the formative activity of virtuous and non-virtuous karma, it is formative predispositions that perform virtuous and non-virtuous karma, but it is not a single self that performs virtuous and non-virtuous karma.

original: // rnam par shes pa yang gzugs dang / sgra la sogs pa'i yul shes par byed pa'i rang bzhin yin pas gzugs mig gi rnam par shes pas shes bar byed bas na chos ni yid kyi rnam bar shes bas shes bar byed kyi bdag gcig pu des shes par byed ba ni ma yin no zhes de
analyzed: // rnam par shes pa yang gzugs dang / sgra la sogs pa'i yul shes par byed pa'i rang bzhin yin pas gzugs mig gi rnam par shes pas shes bar byed bas na chos ni yid kyi rnam bar shes bas shes bar byed kyi bdag gcig pu des shes par byed ba ni ma yin no zhes de
translated: Since consciousness has the nature of cognizing objects such as form, sound, etc., form is cognized by visual consciousness, sound is cognized by auditory consciousness, and so on up to: mental objects are cognized by mental consciousness. But it is not a single self that cognizes.

original: ltar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: ltar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, it should be applied in this way.

original: de lta bas na sems can rnams kyi lus kyi dngos po ni phung po lnga'i bdag nyid yin pas gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed @128b dang ; rnam par shes pa ste dngos po du ma'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: de lta bas na sems can rnams kyi lus kyi dngos po ni phung po lnga'i bdag nyid yin pas gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed @128b dang ; rnam par shes pa ste dngos po du ma'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: Thus, the physical bodies of sentient beings are of the nature of the five aggregates, and so are of the nature of many things: form, feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness.

original: lta ba la sogs pa yang phung po lnga nyid byed par zad kyi phung po rnams ma gtogs par bdag gcig pu zhes bya ba med de zhes khong du chud na bdag gcig pur 'dzin pa las rnam par ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa yang phung po lnga nyid byed par zad kyi phung po rnams ma gtogs par bdag gcig pu zhes bya ba med de zhes khong du chud na bdag gcig pur 'dzin pa las rnam par ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: And the aggregates themselves are the agents of seeing and so on. Apart from the aggregates, there is no so-called self. Understanding this, one turns away from the grasping of a self as a single unit.

original: gcig pur 'dzin pa las log par gyur na gcig pur 'dzin pa'i rgyu las byung ba bdag tu 'dzin pa las kyang log par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gcig pur 'dzin pa las log par gyur na gcig pur 'dzin pa'i rgyu las byung ba bdag tu 'dzin pa las kyang log par 'gyur te /
translated: When one turns away from the grasping of a self as a single unit, one also turns away from the grasping of a self as a real entity, which arises from the grasping of a self as a single unit.

original: de bas na gcig pur 'dzin pa'i gnyen por phung po lnga bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na gcig pur 'dzin pa'i gnyen por phung po lnga bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the five aggregates are taught as the antidote to the grasping of a self as a single unit.

original: za bar 'dzin pa yang bdag tu smra ba rnams ni gang las dge ba'i 'bras bu bde ba dang / las mi dge ba'i 'bras bur sdug bsngal yang bdag des myong zhing las kyi 'bras bu la bdag za bar byed ba dang / gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i yul yang bdag des myong zhing yul la bdag ces za bar byed do zhes 'dzin to //
analyzed: za bar 'dzin pa yang bdag tu smra ba rnams ni gang las dge ba'i 'bras bu bde ba dang / las mi dge ba'i 'bras bur sdug bsngal yang bdag des myong zhing las kyi 'bras bu la bdag za bar byed ba dang / gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i yul yang bdag des myong zhing yul la bdag ces za bar byed do zhes 'dzin to //
translated: They also believe that the self experiences objects such as form and sound and that the self consumes the objects.

original: de ltar bdag la za ba por 'dzin pa'i gnyen por skye mched rnams bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar bdag la za ba por 'dzin pa'i gnyen por skye mched rnams bshad pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the sense spheres are explained as the antidote to the grasping of the self as the experiencer.

original: las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bur bde ba'am /
analyzed: las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bur bde ba'am /
translated: The result of virtuous and nonvirtuous action is experienced as happiness or suffering,

original: sdug bsngal ba dang / gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i yul rnams za bar byed ces bya ba ni las kyi 'bras bu dang yul du dmigs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang / gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i yul rnams za bar byed ces bya ba ni las kyi 'bras bu dang yul du dmigs par byed pa ste /
translated: and objects such as form and sound are consumed.

original: las kyi 'bras bu la dmigs par byed pa yang las gang gis byas pa de nyid kyi las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bu la spyod cing dmigs par byed de /🔽las dge ba dang mi dge ba yang skye mched kyi sgo nas rnam par shes pas byas pas de'i 'bras bu bde ba dang sdug bsngal yang mig gi rnam par shes pa nas /
analyzed: las kyi 'bras bu la dmigs par byed pa yang las gang gis byas pa de nyid kyi las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bu la spyod cing dmigs par byed de / las dge ba dang mi dge ba yang skye mched kyi sgo nas rnam par shes pas byas pas de'i 'bras bu bde ba dang sdug bsngal yang mig gi rnam par shes pa nas /
translated: Also, the one who experiences the result of karma is the one who performs the karma, who experiences and observes the result of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma.🔽Since virtuous and nonvirtuous karma is created by consciousness in terms of the sense bases, the result of that karma, happiness and suffering, is experienced and observed by eye consciousness and so on up to and including mental consciousness.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar dag gis myong zhing dmigs par byed bar zad kyi las kyi 'bras bu la spyod par byed pa'i bdag ni med pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la dmigs shing za bar byed ba yang skye mched nyid kyis za bar byed de /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar dag gis myong zhing dmigs par byed bar zad kyi las kyi 'bras bu la spyod par byed pa'i bdag ni med pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la dmigs shing za bar byed ba yang skye mched nyid kyis za bar byed de /
translated: The self that experiences the result of karma does not exist. Also, the one who observes and consumes objects such as form is consumed by the sense bases.

original: 'di ltar gzugs mig gi skye mched kyis myong zhing dmigs par byed pa nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs mig gi skye mched kyis myong zhing dmigs par byed pa nas /
translated: In this way, form is experienced and observed by the eye sense base and so on up to and including

original: chos kyang yid kyi skye mched kyis myong zhing dmigs par byed par zad kyis de las ma gtogs pa'i las kyi 'bras bu dang / yul myong zhing za bar byed pa'i bdag ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chos kyang yid kyi skye mched kyis myong zhing dmigs par byed par zad kyis de las ma gtogs pa'i las kyi 'bras bu dang / yul myong zhing za bar byed pa'i bdag ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The mind faculty experiences and observes phenomena, but apart from that, there is no self that experiences and observes the results of actions and objects.

original: de ltar las kyi 'bras bu dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i yul myong zhing za bar byed pa ni mig la sogs pa'i skye mched yin gyi de las @129a * //
analyzed: de ltar las kyi 'bras bu dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i yul myong zhing za bar byed pa ni mig la sogs pa'i skye mched yin gyi de las @129a * //
translated: Thus, the sense bases such as the eyes experience and observe the results of actions and objects such as form.

original: gzhan pa'i bdag ces bya ba'i 'bras bu dang / yul za bar byed pa med do zhes khong du chud na za bar 'dzin pa las log par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan pa'i bdag ces bya ba'i 'bras bu dang / yul za bar byed pa med do zhes khong du chud na za bar 'dzin pa las log par 'gyur te /
translated: If one understands that apart from those, there is no so-called self that experiences and observes the results of actions and objects, one will turn away from the grasping of the experiencer.

original: de'i phyir za bar 'dzin pa'i gnyen por skye mched bcu gnyis bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir za bar 'dzin pa'i gnyen por skye mched bcu gnyis bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the twelve sense bases are explained as the antidote to the grasping of the experiencer.

original: byed par 'dzin pa yang bdag tu smra ba rnams las dge ba dang mi dge ba yang bdag des byas la mchod pa dang 'gro ba la sogs pa'i las kyang bdag byed do //
analyzed: byed par 'dzin pa yang bdag tu smra ba rnams las dge ba dang mi dge ba yang bdag des byas la mchod pa dang 'gro ba la sogs pa'i las kyang bdag byed do //
translated: The grasping of the agent is the assertion by proponents of a self that virtue and nonvirtue are performed by that self, and that the self is the agent of actions such as worship and going.

original: bdag de ni phung po las ma gtogs par logs shig na yod par 'dzin to //
analyzed: bdag de ni phung po las ma gtogs par logs shig na yod par 'dzin to //
translated: One grasps that self as existing separately from the aggregates.

original: de ltar bdag de la byed pa por 'dzin pa'i gnyen por khams bco brgyad bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar bdag de la byed pa por 'dzin pa'i gnyen por khams bco brgyad bshad pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the eighteen elements are explained as the antidote to grasping that self as the agent.

original: de las dge ba dang mi dge ba yang mig la sogs pa'i khams kyis byed par zad kyi de las ma gtogs pa'i las byed pa po'i bdag med la /
analyzed: de las dge ba dang mi dge ba yang mig la sogs pa'i khams kyis byed par zad kyi de las ma gtogs pa'i las byed pa po'i bdag med la /
translated: From among those, virtue and nonvirtue are merely performed by the elements such as the eyes and so on. Apart from those, there is no self that is the agent of action.

original: khams nyid kyang byed pa po'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: khams nyid kyang byed pa po'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
translated: The elements themselves are not by nature agents.

original: de'i phyir byed pa med cing rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir khams zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir byed pa med cing rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir khams zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore they are explained to be elements because they are devoid of action and they hold their own characteristics.

original: de ltar bdag byed pa po yang med la khams nyid byed pa po ma yin yang rgyu dang 'bras bu gcig la gcig skye ba ni rgyu yod pa 'bras bu skyed par byed pa po dang / 'bras bu skye ba yang rgyu yod pa tsam la ltos par zad kyi 'bras bu dang rgyu'i rang bzhin las ma gtogs par bdag byed pa po'o zhes bya ba gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar bdag byed pa po yang med la khams nyid byed pa po ma yin yang rgyu dang 'bras bu gcig la gcig skye ba ni rgyu yod pa 'bras bu skyed par byed pa po dang / 'bras bu skye ba yang rgyu yod pa tsam la ltos par zad kyi 'bras bu dang rgyu'i rang bzhin las ma gtogs par bdag byed pa po'o zhes bya ba gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, there is no self as an agent, and although the elements themselves are not agents, the cause and effect are mutually produced. The existent cause is the agent that produces the effect, and the arising of the effect depends only on the mere existence of the cause. Apart from the nature of the effect and the cause, there is no other so-called self as an agent.

original: de ltar las kyang khams bco brgyad kyis byed par zad kyi de las gzhan pa'i bdag byed pa po med do zhes khong du chung na byed pa por 'dzin pa las log par 'dzin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar las kyang khams bco brgyad kyis byed par zad kyi de las gzhan pa'i bdag byed pa po med do zhes khong du chung na byed pa por 'dzin pa las log par 'dzin par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, if one understands that the eighteen elements alone are the agent of action, and that apart from that there is no other self as an agent, one will turn away from grasping an agent.

original: de bas na byed pa por 'dzin pa'i gnyen por khams bco brgyad bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na byed pa por 'dzin pa'i gnyen por khams bco brgyad bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the eighteen elements are explained as the antidote to grasping an agent.

original: de ltar phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyi rang bzhin bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyi rang bzhin bshad nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the nature of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases,

original: da ni slob ma rnams chos kyi mtshan nyid rab tu dbye bas phan gdags par bya ba'i phyir khams bco brgyad nyid nas brtsams nas phung po dang / skye mched dang / khams kyi skabs su bshad pa'i chos rnams la gzugs can du /
analyzed: da ni slob ma rnams chos kyi mtshan nyid rab tu dbye bas phan gdags par bya ba'i phyir khams bco brgyad nyid nas brtsams nas phung po dang / skye mched dang / khams kyi skabs su bshad pa'i chos rnams la gzugs can du /
translated: Now, in order to benefit students by means of the analysis of the characteristics of phenomena, one should begin with the eighteen elements and then undertake and contemplate the analysis of phenomena explained in the chapters on the aggregates, bases and elements.🔽How many are form?

original: gzugs med pa du /
analyzed: gzugs med pa du /
translated: How many are not form?

original: bltar yod pa du /🔽bltar med pa du zhes bya ba la sogs pa rab tu dbye ba brtsams shing bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: bltar yod pa du / bltar med pa du zhes bya ba la sogs pa rab tu dbye ba brtsams shing bsam par bya'o //
translated: How many are visible?🔽How many are not visible?🔽And so on.

original: de ltar rab tu dbye ba bsam pa yang khams bco brgyad kyi chos nyid la gzugs can du /
analyzed: de ltar rab tu dbye ba bsam pa yang khams bco brgyad kyi chos nyid la gzugs can du /
translated: Also, the analysis of phenomena should be undertaken in terms of the reality of the eighteen elements, such as how many are form and how many are not form.

original: gzugs med pa du zhes bya ba dbye ba brtsam gyi phung po lnga dang / skye mched bcu gnyis @129b kyi chos las brtsams te ni rab tu dbye ba mi brtsam mo //
analyzed: gzugs med pa du zhes bya ba dbye ba brtsam gyi phung po lnga dang / skye mched bcu gnyis @129b kyi chos las brtsams te ni rab tu dbye ba mi brtsam mo //
translated: But the analysis should not be undertaken in terms of the phenomena of the five aggregates and twelve sense bases.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar phung bo lnga bshad pa'i skabs su phung po lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar phung bo lnga bshad pa'i skabs su phung po lnga gang zhe na /
translated: Because in the section explaining the five aggregates, it says: “What are the five aggregates?

original: gzugs kyi phung po dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bstan pa la tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes par sems rnam pa bzhir phye ste bstan kyang gzugs la spyir gzugs kyi phung po zhes bsdus te bstan gyi gzugs rnam par ma phye bas gzugs can du zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par dbye ba rtogs par bya ba dka' ba dang /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bstan pa la tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes par sems rnam pa bzhir phye ste bstan kyang gzugs la spyir gzugs kyi phung po zhes bsdus te bstan gyi gzugs rnam par ma phye bas gzugs can du zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par dbye ba rtogs par bya ba dka' ba dang /
translated: Although the mind is divided into four types, feeling, discernment, formation and consciousness, form is generally taught as the aggregate of form without being divided into different types.

original: skye mched bcu gnyis su yang mig gi skye mched nas lus kyi skye mched kyi bar du lnga dang / gzugs kyi skye mched nas reg bya'i skye mched kyi bar du lnga ste /
analyzed: skye mched bcu gnyis su yang mig gi skye mched nas lus kyi skye mched kyi bar du lnga dang / gzugs kyi skye mched nas reg bya'i skye mched kyi bar du lnga ste /
translated: The twelve sense bases are also taught: the five from the eye sense base to the body sense base and the five from the form sense base to the tactile objects sense base.

original: gzugs bcur phye yang sems rnam par ma phye ste /
analyzed: gzugs bcur phye yang sems rnam par ma phye ste /
translated: Although form is divided into ten, the mind is not divided.

original: rnam par shes pa brgyad car yid kyi khams su bsdus pas gzugs can du zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par dbye ba rtogs par dka'i /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa brgyad car yid kyi khams su bsdus pas gzugs can du zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par dbye ba rtogs par dka'i /
translated: Since the eight consciousnesses are included in the mind constituent, it is difficult to understand the analysis of such passages as “Are any of the constituents physical?”

original: khams kyi skabs su ni gzugs dang / sems gnyis rnam par phye ste /
analyzed: khams kyi skabs su ni gzugs dang / sems gnyis rnam par phye ste /
translated: In the context of the constituents, form and mind are distinguished.

original: gzugs la yang mig gi khams nas lus kyi khams kyi bar du lnga dang / gzugs kyi khams na reg bya'i khams kyi bar du bcur phye la /
analyzed: gzugs la yang mig gi khams nas lus kyi khams kyi bar du lnga dang / gzugs kyi khams na reg bya'i khams kyi bar du bcur phye la /
translated: Form is distinguished into five from the eye constituent to the body constituent and into ten from the form constituent to the tactility constituent.🔽Mind is distinguished into six from the eye-consciousness constituent to the mind constituent and into seven mental constituents by adding the mind constituent.

original: sems la yang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar du drug dang / yid kyi khams kyis bsnan te sems kyi khams bdun du phye bas gzugs can du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye ba nas brtsams pa bde blag tu rtog par 'gyur bas na khams nyid las brtsams te rab tu dbye ba bsam par bya'i /
analyzed: sems la yang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar du drug dang / yid kyi khams kyis bsnan te sems kyi khams bdun du phye bas gzugs can du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye ba nas brtsams pa bde blag tu rtog par 'gyur bas na khams nyid las brtsams te rab tu dbye ba bsam par bya'i /
translated: Therefore, since it is easy to understand the analysis of such passages as “Are any of the constituents physical?” and so on, the analysis should be understood in terms of the constituents themselves.

original: phung po dang skye mched las brtsams nas rab tu dbye ba bsam par mi bya ste /
analyzed: phung po dang skye mched las brtsams nas rab tu dbye ba bsam par mi bya ste /
translated: One should not imagine that the aggregates and bases are differentiated in terms of the elements.

original: de'i phyir / gzhung las kyang khams bco brgyad la gzugs can du zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / gzhung las kyang khams bco brgyad la gzugs can du zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, the treatise states, “How many of the eighteen elements are form?” and so on.

original: khams bco brgyad la zhes bya ba ni khams bco brgyad kyi nang na gzugs dang bcas pa ni du zhig yod ces bya ba'i don to //🔽de la gzhig tu rung ba'am /
analyzed: khams bco brgyad la zhes bya ba ni khams bco brgyad kyi nang na gzugs dang bcas pa ni du zhig yod ces bya ba'i don to // de la gzhig tu rung ba'am /
translated: How many of the eighteen elements are form?

original: gnod par byar rung bas na gzugs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gnod par byar rung bas na gzugs zhes bya ste /
translated: That which is suitable to be destroyed or that which is suitable to be harmed is called form.

original: rang gi gnas su gzhan skye ba'i bar chad dang bgegs byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyis gnod par byed pas gzugs @130a * //
analyzed: rang gi gnas su gzhan skye ba'i bar chad dang bgegs byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyis gnod par byed pas gzugs @130a * //
translated: It is called form because it is harmed by the characteristic of obstructing or impeding the arising of another in its own location.

original: zhes bya'o // yang na gnas pa dang gnas kyi mtshan nyid kyi gzugs gang la yod pas bdag gi gnas su gzhan skye ba'i bgegs byed pa gzugs can zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // yang na gnas pa dang gnas kyi mtshan nyid kyi gzugs gang la yod pas bdag gi gnas su gzhan skye ba'i bgegs byed pa gzugs can zhes bya ste /
translated: Or, that which has the characteristic of form as a basis is called form because it obstructs the arising of another in its own location.

original: mig gi khams nas lus kyi khams kyi bar du ni gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mig gi khams nas lus kyi khams kyi bar du ni gnas pa'o //
translated: The eye element up to the body element are the basis.

original: brgal ba / gnas dang gnas pa'i sgo nas bdag gi gnas su gzhan skye ba'i bgegs byed pa la gzugs can zhes bya na de lta na ni mig gi rnam par shes pa yang mig ge dbang po la gnas na bdag gi gnas su gzhan skye ba'i bgegs byed bas mig
analyzed: brgal ba / gnas dang gnas pa'i sgo nas bdag gi gnas su gzhan skye ba'i bgegs byed pa la gzugs can zhes bya na de lta na ni mig gi rnam par shes pa yang mig ge dbang po la gnas na bdag gi gnas su gzhan skye ba'i bgegs byed bas mig
translated: If it is said that form obstructs other forms in terms of abiding and the abider, then eye consciousness would also be form because it obstructs other forms arising in the abode of the eye organ.🔽

original: gi rnam par shes pa yang gzugs can du 'gyur ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gi rnam par shes pa yang gzugs can du 'gyur ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Objection: If form is called obstructive because it obstructs the arising of another in its own place, then eye consciousness would also be form because it obstructs the arising of another in its own place.

original: lan du / mig gi rnam bar shes pa gzugs can gyi skyon du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: lan du / mig gi rnam bar shes pa gzugs can gyi skyon du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Reply: The fault of eye consciousness being form does not arise.

original: 'di ltar gzhong pa'i steng na shing thog gnas te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhong pa'i steng na shing thog gnas te /
translated: This is because, for example, fruit placed on a plate

original: rang gi gnas su gzhan 'ong ba'i bgegs byed pa lta bur mig gi dbang po la mig gi rnam par shes pa gnas pa na rang gi gnas su skye ba'i bgegs mi byed pas na rnam par shes pa rnams gzugs can gyi skyon du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi gnas su gzhan 'ong ba'i bgegs byed pa lta bur mig gi dbang po la mig gi rnam par shes pa gnas pa na rang gi gnas su skye ba'i bgegs mi byed pas na rnam par shes pa rnams gzugs can gyi skyon du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: does not obstruct the arising of another in its own place when it is placed on the eye sense faculty.

original: lan du / gang dag gzugs kyi phung po'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lan du / gang dag gzugs kyi phung po'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Those that are the entity of the form aggregate are called form.

original: gang gzugs kyi phung por bshad pa mig gi khams nas lus kyi khams kyi bar du lnga dang / gzugs kyi khams nas reg bya'i khams kyi bar du lnga ste /
analyzed: gang gzugs kyi phung por bshad pa mig gi khams nas lus kyi khams kyi bar du lnga dang / gzugs kyi khams nas reg bya'i khams kyi bar du lnga ste /
translated: The five from the eye element to the body element and the five from the form element to the tactile object element are explained as the form aggregate.

original: bcu ni rang gi gnas su gzhan skye ba'i bgegs byed pas na gzugs can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bcu ni rang gi gnas su gzhan skye ba'i bgegs byed pas na gzugs can zhes bya'o //
translated: The ten are called form because they obstruct the arising of other things in their own location.

original: brgal ba / gal te gzugs kyi phung por gtogs pa la gzugs can zhes bya na /
analyzed: brgal ba / gal te gzugs kyi phung por gtogs pa la gzugs can zhes bya na /
translated: Objection: If those belonging to the form aggregate are called form,

original: khams bco brgyad kyi nang na gzugs kyi phung por gtogs pa rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gnas lta bu chos kyi khams su bsdus pas chos kyi khams kun kyang gzugs can du 'gyur ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: khams bco brgyad kyi nang na gzugs kyi phung por gtogs pa rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gnas lta bu chos kyi khams su bsdus pas chos kyi khams kun kyang gzugs can du 'gyur ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then the error would arise that all the phenomena element would be form because the phenomena element includes the form aggregate, such as the imperceptible form base, among the eighteen elements.

original: chos kyi khams kyi nang na gzugs can rnam par rig byed ma yin pa yod kyang chos kyi khams gzugs can gyi skyon du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos kyi khams kyi nang na gzugs can rnam par rig byed ma yin pa yod kyang chos kyi khams gzugs can gyi skyon du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Although imperceptible form exists in the element of mental objects, the element of mental objects is not subject to the fault of being form.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin ba de rten dang brten pa'i sgo nas rang gi gnas su gzhan skye ba'i bgegs can gyi gzugs ma yin pas na gzugs can zhes mi bya la /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin ba de rten dang brten pa'i sgo nas rang gi gnas su gzhan skye ba'i bgegs can gyi gzugs ma yin pas na gzugs can zhes mi bya la /
translated: That imperceptible form is not form because it does not obstruct the arising of another in its own location, either as a basis or as something based on a basis.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa gzhan yang rten dang brten pa'i sgo nas rang gi gnas su gzhan @130b skye ba'i bgegs byed pa ma yin pas gzugs can zhes mi bya ste /
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa gzhan yang rten dang brten pa'i sgo nas rang gi gnas su gzhan @130b skye ba'i bgegs byed pa ma yin pas gzugs can zhes mi bya ste /
translated: Other things, such as feeling, are not form because they do not obstruct the arising of another in their own location, either as a basis or as something based on a basis.

original: de bas na gzugs kyi khams gzugs can gyi skyon du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na gzugs kyi khams gzugs can gyi skyon du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the element of form is not subject to the fault of being form.🔽How many are formless?

original: gzugs med pa du zhes bya ba ni de ltar na khams bcu gzugs can na gzugs med pa'i khams su du yod ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs med pa du zhes bya ba ni de ltar na khams bcu gzugs can na gzugs med pa'i khams su du yod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of this question is: Among the ten elements that are form, how many are formless elements?

original: lhag ma rnams so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams so zhes bya ba la /
translated: The remaining ones.

original: khams bcu bshad pa'i lhag ma ni khams brgyad du lus pa ste /
analyzed: khams bcu bshad pa'i lhag ma ni khams brgyad du lus pa ste /
translated: The remaining ten elements are the eight elements that remain after subtracting the form element.

original: khams brgyad la gzugs med pa zhes bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: khams brgyad la gzugs med pa zhes bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the statement “the eight elements are called formless” is that they are not form.

original: khams brgyad po de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: khams brgyad po de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight elements?

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar du /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar du /
translated: The six elements from the eye consciousness element to the mind consciousness element,

original: drug dang yid kyi khams te bdun dang / chos kyi khams kyis bsnan nas brgyad de /
analyzed: drug dang yid kyi khams te bdun dang / chos kyi khams kyis bsnan nas brgyad de /
translated: the mind element, and the phenomena element, making eight.

original: de dag ni rten dang brten pa'i sgo nas rang gi gnas su gzhan skye ba'i bgegs byed pa ma yin pas gzugs med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni rten dang brten pa'i sgo nas rang gi gnas su gzhan skye ba'i bgegs byed pa ma yin pas gzugs med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called formless because they do not obstruct the arising of other elements in their own location, in terms of both the basis and the dependent.

original: bltar yod pa du zhes bya ba la /🔽khams bco brgyad bshad pa'i skabs yin pas na /
analyzed: bltar yod pa du zhes bya ba la / khams bco brgyad bshad pa'i skabs yin pas na /
translated: How many are visible?🔽Since the context is the explanation of the eighteen elements,

original: khams bco brgyad kyi nang nas khams du zhig ni bltar yod pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khams bco brgyad kyi nang nas khams du zhig ni bltar yod pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the question is, “How many of the eighteen elements are visible?”

original: de la bltar yod pa du zhig bya ba ni gnas 'di na gzugs 'di lta bu zhig yod do zhes mig gis bltar yod pa dang bcas pa la yod do //
analyzed: de la bltar yod pa du zhig bya ba ni gnas 'di na gzugs 'di lta bu zhig yod do zhes mig gis bltar yod pa dang bcas pa la yod do //
translated: This means that they are visible to the eye, as in the statement, “There is such and such a form in this place.”

original: lan du / gzugs kyi khams gcig ste zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lan du / gzugs kyi khams gcig ste zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The root text replies, “One element is visible.”

original: gzugs kyi khams ni dbang po lnga dang / yul lnga dang bcu las khams gcig ste /🔽mig gi yul gzugs kyi khams gcig pu ni bltar yod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams ni dbang po lnga dang / yul lnga dang bcu las khams gcig ste / mig gi yul gzugs kyi khams gcig pu ni bltar yod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The form element is one of the ten elements that consist of the five sense faculties and their five objects.

original: bltar yod pa'i don nyid gang yin pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bltar yod pa'i don nyid gang yin pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The form element, which is the object of the eye faculty, is the only element that is visible.

original: yul bltar yod pa'i zhes bya ba smos te /🔽yul lam gnas gang na dngos po gang yin ba mig gis bltar rung ba ni bltar yod pa zhes bya ste /🔽mig gi khams kyi yul gzugs kyi khams ni gzugs 'di gnas 'di na gnas so //
analyzed: yul bltar yod pa'i zhes bya ba smos te / yul lam gnas gang na dngos po gang yin ba mig gis bltar rung ba ni bltar yod pa zhes bya ste / mig gi khams kyi yul gzugs kyi khams ni gzugs 'di gnas 'di na gnas so //
translated: The root text states, “The object that is visible.”🔽The object or place where a thing exists is visible to the eye.🔽The form element, which is the object of the eye faculty, is the only element that is visible.

original: mig gis bltar rung bas na bltar yod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mig gis bltar rung bas na bltar yod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The form element is the object of the eye faculty. It is visible because it is suitable to be seen by the eye.

original: bltar med pa du zhes bya ba ni khams bco brgyad kyi nang nas mig gis bltar mi rung ba ni du yod ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bltar med pa du zhes bya ba ni khams bco brgyad kyi nang nas mig gis bltar mi rung ba ni du yod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is: How many of the eighteen elements are not visible by means of the eye?

original: lhag ma rnams so zhes bya ba ni mig gi yul gzugs gcig po bltar yod par bshad pa dang / phyin lhag ma khams bcu bdun lus pa ni bltar med pa'o zhes bya bar grub ste /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams so zhes bya ba ni mig gi yul gzugs gcig po bltar yod par bshad pa dang / phyin lhag ma khams bcu bdun lus pa ni bltar med pa'o zhes bya bar grub ste /
translated: The answer is: The rest. The rest of the elements are not visible. The one element that is visible is form, the object of the eye.

original: @131a * // bcu bdun po gang zhe na /
analyzed: @131a * // bcu bdun po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the seventeen?

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dgu'i steng du /
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dgu'i steng du /
translated: The eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, form, sound, odor, taste, and tangible-object elements,

original: chos kyi khams kyis bsnan te bcu dang / sems kyi khams bdun gyis bsnan te bcu bdun no //
analyzed: chos kyi khams kyis bsnan te bcu dang / sems kyi khams bdun gyis bsnan te bcu bdun no //
translated: plus the mental element and the entity element.

original: de dag ni gnas 'di na gzugs 'di 'dra ba zhig gnas zhes mig gis bltar mi rung bas bltar med pa'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni gnas 'di na gzugs 'di 'dra ba zhig gnas zhes mig gis bltar mi rung bas bltar med pa'o zhes bya'o //
translated: They are not visible because one cannot see them with the eye and say, “Here it is, such and such an element.”

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa du zhes bya ba la /
translated: How many are resistant?

original: khams bco brgyad bshad pa'i skabs yin pas khams bco brgyad kyi nang nas thogs pa dang bcas pa du yod ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khams bco brgyad bshad pa'i skabs yin pas khams bco brgyad kyi nang nas thogs pa dang bcas pa du yod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since this is the section on the eighteen elements, the meaning of the question is how many of the eighteen elements are impeded?

original: bdag gang na gnas pa'i gnas su gzhan gnas pa'i go gcod cing bgegs byed pa la thogs pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gang na gnas pa'i gnas su gzhan gnas pa'i go gcod cing bgegs byed pa la thogs pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which impedes and obstructs the location of another in the location where the self exists is said to be impeded.

original: dmigs pa thogs pa dang bcas pa ni mig gi rnam bar shes pa gzugs la dmigs te thogs pa med kyang sgral mi dmigs te thogs pa dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa sgra la dmigs te thogs pa med kyang gzugs la mi dmigs te thogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa thogs pa dang bcas pa ni mig gi rnam bar shes pa gzugs la dmigs te thogs pa med kyang sgral mi dmigs te thogs pa dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa sgra la dmigs te thogs pa med kyang gzugs la mi dmigs te thogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: That which is impeded in terms of focal object is like the eye consciousness that focuses on form and is not impeded, but does not focus on sound and is impeded. The ear consciousness focuses on sound and is not impeded, but does not focus on form and is impeded.

original: bar du gcod pa'i thogs pa dang bcas pa ni rang gnas pa'i gnas su gzhan skye zhing 'byung ba'i bgegs byed cing go gcod pa'o //
analyzed: bar du gcod pa'i thogs pa dang bcas pa ni rang gnas pa'i gnas su gzhan skye zhing 'byung ba'i bgegs byed cing go gcod pa'o //
translated: That which is impeded in terms of obstruction is that which obstructs and impedes the arising and occurrence of another in the location where it exists.

original: de ltar thogs pa dang bcas pa rnam pa gsum las 'di'i skabs su yul thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / dmigs pa thogs pa dang bcas pa la ni mi bya'i /
analyzed: de ltar thogs pa dang bcas pa rnam pa gsum las 'di'i skabs su yul thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / dmigs pa thogs pa dang bcas pa la ni mi bya'i /
translated: Thus, among the three that are obstructed, here it is taught that the meaning of obstructed is not to be taken as obstructed object-field or obstructed object of observation.

original: bar du gcod pa'i thogs pa dang bcas pa la ni bya bar bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bar du gcod pa'i thogs pa dang bcas pa la ni bya bar bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: Rather, it is to be taken as obstructed by obstruction that interrupts.

original: gang la gang thogs pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang la gang thogs pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Thus, it is said, “Obstructed is that which is obstructed by that.”

original: bar du gcod pa'i thogs pa dang bcas pa ni rang gi phyogs su gzhan 'byung ba la bgegs byed pa ste /
analyzed: bar du gcod pa'i thogs pa dang bcas pa ni rang gi phyogs su gzhan 'byung ba la bgegs byed pa ste /
translated: Obstructed by obstruction that interrupts is that which impedes the arising of another in its own place.

original: dngos po gang rang gi gnas pa las rang gi phyogs su dngos po gzhan 'byung ba la bar chad byed pa dang / dngos po gzhan der 'ongs pa yang de la bar du gcod pa gnyi ga la thogs pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po gang rang gi gnas pa las rang gi phyogs su dngos po gzhan 'byung ba la bar chad byed pa dang / dngos po gzhan der 'ongs pa yang de la bar du gcod pa gnyi ga la thogs pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which impedes the arising of another entity in its own place from its own state and that which impedes the arrival of another entity there are both called obstructed.

original: mig la sogs pa'i khams bcu po yang de dag gcig la gcig rang gi phyogs su byung ba la bgegs byed cing bar du gcod par byed pas na thogs pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i khams bcu po yang de dag gcig la gcig rang gi phyogs su byung ba la bgegs byed cing bar du gcod par byed pas na thogs pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The ten elements such as the eye are said to be impeded because they impede and obstruct the arising of their own part.

original: khams bcu thogs pa dang bcas so zhes bshad na gzhung las ma byung yang sems kyi khams bdun dang / chos kyi khams kyis bsnan te brgyad @131b ne thogs pa med pa yin par zhar gyis grub bo //
analyzed: khams bcu thogs pa dang bcas so zhes bshad na gzhung las ma byung yang sems kyi khams bdun dang / chos kyi khams kyis bsnan te brgyad @131b ne thogs pa med pa yin par zhar gyis grub bo //
translated: Although it is not mentioned in the treatise, it is established by implication that the seven mental elements and the phenomena element are unimpeded anāvaraṇa because they are said to be impeded.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: de dag rang gi phyogs su gzhan 'ong ba'i bgegs dang bar chad du mi byed pa'i phyir thogs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag rang gi phyogs su gzhan 'ong ba'i bgegs dang bar chad du mi byed pa'i phyir thogs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are said to be unimpeded because they do not impede or obstruct the arising of other things in their own part.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa du zhes bya ba la /
translated: How many are contaminated?

original: khams bco brgyad bshad pa'i skabs yin bas khams bco brgyad kyi nang nas zag pa dang bcas pa'i khams du yod ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khams bco brgyad bshad pa'i skabs yin bas khams bco brgyad kyi nang nas zag pa dang bcas pa'i khams du yod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since this is the section on the eighteen elements, the question is how many of the eighteen elements are contaminated.

original: nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is associated with the defilements is said to be “impure”.

original: bco lnga dang tha ma gsum gyi cha'o zhes bya ba la mig gi dbang po nas lus kyi dbang po'i bar du dbang po lnga'i khams dang / gzugs nas reg bya'i bar du yul lnga'i khams dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du rnam par shes pa lnga'i khams te /
analyzed: bco lnga dang tha ma gsum gyi cha'o zhes bya ba la mig gi dbang po nas lus kyi dbang po'i bar du dbang po lnga'i khams dang / gzugs nas reg bya'i bar du yul lnga'i khams dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du rnam par shes pa lnga'i khams te /
translated: Fifteen and the last three parts. The five elements of the sense faculties, from the eye faculty to the body faculty, the five elements of the sense objects, from visible form to tangible, and the five elements of consciousness, from eye consciousness to body consciousness.

original: bco lnga po 'di dag ni gcig tu zag pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bco lnga po 'di dag ni gcig tu zag pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: These fifteen are said to be “always impure”.

original: de dag la nam du yang zag pa med pa'i rang bzhin mi srid kyi /
analyzed: de dag la nam du yang zag pa med pa'i rang bzhin mi srid kyi /
translated: Because the nature of being without impurity is never possible for them.

original: dus thams cad du zag pa dang bcas pa 'ba' zhig gi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: dus thams cad du zag pa dang bcas pa 'ba' zhig gi rang bzhin no //
translated: They are only of the nature of being always impure.

original: gzhan yang tha ma gsum gyi cha ni zag pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang tha ma gsum gyi cha ni zag pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: Moreover, the last three parts are impure.

original: gsum nyi tshe'i tshig smos kyi /
analyzed: gsum nyi tshe'i tshig smos kyi /
translated: The word “three” is used to indicate only a part of the three.

original: tha ma'i tshig ma smos na ni thog ma gsum yang yod de /
analyzed: tha ma'i tshig ma smos na ni thog ma gsum yang yod de /
translated: If the word “last” were not used, then the first three would also exist.

original: mig dang gzugs dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams thog ma gsum yang yod pas de'i phyir tha ma gsum gyi tshig smos so //
analyzed: mig dang gzugs dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams thog ma gsum yang yod pas de'i phyir tha ma gsum gyi tshig smos so //
translated: The last three are mentioned because the first three elements of eye, form, and eye consciousness exist.

original: khams bco brgyad la mig la sogs pa rten drug gi tha ma ni yid kyi khams yin la /
analyzed: khams bco brgyad la mig la sogs pa rten drug gi tha ma ni yid kyi khams yin la /

translated: Those who are free from attachment to the form realm are born in the formless realm.
