analyzed: de bas na gzugs med pa'i khams su mig nas lus kyi khams kyi bar du lnga dang / gzugs nas reg bya'i khams kyi bar du lnga ste /
translated: Therefore, the five from the eye element to the body element and the five from the form element to the tangible object element are not associated with the formless realm.

original: gzugs kyi rang bzhin gyi khams bcu dang / de dag la brten cing dmigs pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams lnga'i bar du ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi rang bzhin gyi khams bcu dang / de dag la brten cing dmigs pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams lnga'i bar du ste /
translated: The ten elements that are by nature form and the five elements from the eye consciousness element to the body consciousness element that are supported on and focus on those.🔽

original: bco lnga ni gzugs med pa'i khams na med do //
analyzed: bco lnga ni gzugs med pa'i khams na med do //
translated: The fifteen elements that are not found in the formless realm are the ten elements that are by nature form and the five elements that are consciousness, from the eye-consciousness element to the body-consciousness element, which are supported on and focus on those ten elements.

original: yid dang chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams gsum la zag pa dang bcas pa'i rang bzhin yang yod /
analyzed: yid dang chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams gsum la zag pa dang bcas pa'i rang bzhin yang yod /
translated: The three elements of the mental faculty, mental objects, and mental consciousness have two natures: they are either contaminated or uncontaminated.

original: zag pa med pa'i rang bzhin yang yod pa las gzugs med pa'i khams na phung po zag pa dang bcas pa'i yid dang ldan na zag pa med pa dang yang ldan nam snyam pa la gang zag pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i rang bzhin yang yod pa las gzugs med pa'i khams na phung po zag pa dang bcas pa'i yid dang ldan na zag pa med pa dang yang ldan nam snyam pa la gang zag pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The phrase “those that are contaminated” is stated in response to the question, “If one who possesses a contaminated mind in the formless realm also possesses an uncontaminated mind?”

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni so so skye bo'i yid kyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams zag pa dang bcas pa gsum po dang ldan no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni so so skye bo'i yid kyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams zag pa dang bcas pa gsum po dang ldan no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In the formless realm, one possesses three: the mental element of ordinary beings, the element of mental consciousness, and the element of mental objects, which are all with-outflows.

original: mi ldan pa du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi ldan pa du zhes bya ba la /
translated: How many are not possessed?

original: khams gsum du ma gtogs pa'am /
analyzed: khams gsum du ma gtogs pa'am /
translated: The meaning is: How many elements are not possessed in the three realms?

original: 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i khams kyi sred @133b pas ma zin sred pas ma dmigs pa ni mi ldan pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i khams kyi sred @133b pas ma zin sred pas ma dmigs pa ni mi ldan pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That which is not included in the desire, form, or formless realms, and is not grasped by craving for the desire, form, or formless realms, is called not possessed.

original: khams bco brgyad las khams gsum gang dang yang mi ldan pa'i khams du yod ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khams bco brgyad las khams gsum gang dang yang mi ldan pa'i khams du yod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: How many elements are not possessed in any of the three realms?

original: de nyid zag pa med pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de nyid zag pa med pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: That itself is uncontaminated.

original: yid kyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams tha ma gsum po dag nyid gang 'phags pa'i lam du gtogs pa'i yid kyi khams dang chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams zag pa med pa dang /
analyzed: yid kyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams tha ma gsum po dag nyid gang 'phags pa'i lam du gtogs pa'i yid kyi khams dang chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams zag pa med pa dang /
translated: The last three elements—the mental element, the phenomena element, and the mental consciousness element—are the uncontaminated mental element, the phenomena element, and the mental consciousness element that are included in the ārya’s path.

original: chos kyi khams las 'dus ma byas bzhi zag pa med pa'i rang bzhin de gsum ni khams gsum dang mi ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi khams las 'dus ma byas bzhi zag pa med pa'i rang bzhin de gsum ni khams gsum dang mi ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: And the four unconditioned phenomena of the phenomena element are uncontaminated by nature. These three are called “not conjoined with the three realms.”🔽How many are included in the aggregates?

original: phung por bsdus ba du zhes bya ba ni khams bco brgyad bshad pa'i skabs yin pas khams bco brgyad kyi nang nas phung po lngar khams du bsdus zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phung por bsdus ba du zhes bya ba ni khams bco brgyad bshad pa'i skabs yin pas khams bco brgyad kyi nang nas phung po lngar khams du bsdus zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the section on the eighteen elements. Therefore, it means, “How many elements are included in the five aggregates?”🔽Except for the unconditioned phenomena.

original: 'dus ma byas ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas bzhi phung po'i nang du ma bshad pas 'dus ma byas bzhi bkol te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas bzhi phung po'i nang du ma bshad pas 'dus ma byas bzhi bkol te /
translated: The four unconditioned phenomena are not explained as being included in the aggregates. Therefore, the four unconditioned phenomena are excluded.

original: mig gi khams nas yid kyi bar du drug dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du drug dang / gzugs kyi khams nas reg bya'i khams kyi bar du lnga dang / chos kyi khams la 'dus ma byas bzhi gzhag ste /
analyzed: mig gi khams nas yid kyi bar du drug dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du drug dang / gzugs kyi khams nas reg bya'i khams kyi bar du lnga dang / chos kyi khams la 'dus ma byas bzhi gzhag ste /
translated: The six elements from eye to mind, the six elements from eye consciousness to mind consciousness, the five elements from form to tangible object, and the four unconditioned phenomena are included in the phenomena element.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang bzhi ste /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang bzhi ste /
translated: The four unconditioned phenomena are space, analytical cessation, nonanalytical cessation, and suchness.

original: de rnams ni phung po lngar 'dus so //
analyzed: de rnams ni phung po lngar 'dus so //
translated: These are included in the five aggregates.🔽How many are included in the appropriated aggregates?

original: nye bar len pa'i phung por bsdus pa du zhes bya ba ni khams bco brgyad bshad pa'i skabs yin pas khams bco brgyad kyi nang nas zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung por bsdus pa'i khams su yod ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung por bsdus pa du zhes bya ba ni khams bco brgyad bshad pa'i skabs yin pas khams bco brgyad kyi nang nas zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung por bsdus pa'i khams su yod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the context for explaining the eighteen elements, so the meaning is: How many elements are included in the aggregates that possess contaminants?

original: gang dag zag pa dang bcas pa'i rnams so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang dag zag pa dang bcas pa'i rnams so zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those that possess contaminants are the aggregates.

original: khams bco brgyad las gang zag pa dang bcas pa'i khams ni nye bar len pa'i phung por bsdus so //
analyzed: khams bco brgyad las gang zag pa dang bcas pa'i khams ni nye bar len pa'i phung por bsdus so //
translated: From among the eighteen elements, the contaminated elements are included in the appropriated aggregates.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: Which ones?

original: dbang po lnga dang / yul lnga dang / rnam par shes pa lnga dang / yid dang chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams tha ma gsum la gang zag pa dang bcas pa'i rang bzhin dang / zag pa med pa'i rang bzhin yod pa las gang zag pa dang bcas pa'i rang bzhin gsum ste /
analyzed: dbang po lnga dang / yul lnga dang / rnam par shes pa lnga dang / yid dang chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams tha ma gsum la gang zag pa dang bcas pa'i rang bzhin dang / zag pa med pa'i rang bzhin yod pa las gang zag pa dang bcas pa'i rang bzhin gsum ste /
translated: The five sense faculties, the five objects, the five consciousnesses, and the last three elements: mind, mental objects, and the mental consciousness. The last three have both contaminated and uncontaminated natures.

original: de rnams ni nye bar len pa'i phung por bsdus so //
analyzed: de rnams ni nye bar len pa'i phung por bsdus so //
translated: The contaminated natures of these three are included in the appropriated aggregates.

original: dge ba du mi dge ba du lung du ma bstan pa du zhes bya ba la /🔽khams bco brgyad bshad pa'i @134a * //🔽skabs yin pas khams du zhig ni dge ba yin /
analyzed: dge ba du mi dge ba du lung du ma bstan pa du zhes bya ba la / khams bco brgyad bshad pa'i @134a * // skabs yin pas khams du zhig ni dge ba yin /
translated: How many are virtuous, how many are nonvirtuous, and how many are neutral?

original: khams du zhig ni mi dge ba yin /🔽khams du zhig ni lung du ma bstan pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khams du zhig ni mi dge ba yin /🔽khams du zhig ni lung du ma bstan pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since this is the section that explains the eighteen elements, the question is how many elements are virtuous, how many are nonvirtuous, and how many are neutral.

original: de la srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i las ngan pa spangs pa ni dge ba'o //
analyzed: de la srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i las ngan pa spangs pa ni dge ba'o //
translated: The abandonment of evil actions such as killing is virtue.

original: srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i las ngan pa ma spangs pa ni mi dge ba'o /
analyzed: srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i las ngan pa ma spangs pa ni mi dge ba'o /
translated: The non-abandonment of evil actions such as killing is non-virtue.

original: // / dge ba'i rang bzhin yang ma yin mi dge ba'i rang bzhin yang ma yin pa ni lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: // / dge ba'i rang bzhin yang ma yin mi dge ba'i rang bzhin yang ma yin pa ni lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: That which is neither virtuous nor non-virtuous is indeterminate.

original: de la dge ba la rnam pa bzhi yod de /
analyzed: de la dge ba la rnam pa bzhi yod de /
translated: Virtue is of four kinds:

original: rang bzhin gyis dge ba dang / ldan pa'i dge ba dang / bskyed pa'i dge ba dang / don dam pa'i dge ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis dge ba dang / ldan pa'i dge ba dang / bskyed pa'i dge ba dang / don dam pa'i dge ba'o //
translated: natural virtue, virtue by association, virtue by motivation, and virtue by consecration.

original: 'di ltar 'dod ma chags pa dang ; zhe mi sdang ba dang / gti mi mug pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang / lnga ni rang bzhin gyis dge ba'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod ma chags pa dang ; zhe mi sdang ba dang / gti mi mug pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang / lnga ni rang bzhin gyis dge ba'o zhes bya'o //
translated: Non-greed, non-hatred, non-delusion, conscience, and shame are called natural virtues.

original: dge ba de lnga dang ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni ldan pa'i dge ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba de lnga dang ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni ldan pa'i dge ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The mind and mental factors associated with these five virtues are called virtue by association.

original: dge ba dang ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung bas bskyed pa'i lus kyi sgo nas thal mo sbyar ba dang / ngag gi sgo nas bstod pa dang / kha ton klog pa ni bskyed pa'i dge ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung bas bskyed pa'i lus kyi sgo nas thal mo sbyar ba dang / ngag gi sgo nas bstod pa dang / kha ton klog pa ni bskyed pa'i dge ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The virtue of generation is the physical virtue of joining one's palms in reverence, and the verbal virtue of praise and recitation, which are generated by a virtuous mind and mental functions.

original: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa dang / de bzhin nyid ni don dam par dge ba zhes bya'o /
analyzed: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa dang / de bzhin nyid ni don dam par dge ba zhes bya'o /
translated: The virtue of ultimate truth is the cessation resulting from careful consideration and suchness.

original: mi dge ba la yang rnam pa bzhi yod de /
analyzed: mi dge ba la yang rnam pa bzhi yod de /
translated: There are four kinds of nonvirtue:

original: rang bzhin gyis mi dge ba dang / ldan pas mi dge ba dang / bskyed pas mi dge ba dang / don dam par mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis mi dge ba dang / ldan pas mi dge ba dang / bskyed pas mi dge ba dang / don dam par mi dge ba'o //
translated: natural nonvirtue, nonvirtue by association, nonvirtue by generation, and nonvirtue by ultimate truth.

original: de la rang bzhin gyis mi dge ba ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / ngo tsha mi shes pa dang / khrel med pa dang lnga'o //
analyzed: de la rang bzhin gyis mi dge ba ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / ngo tsha mi shes pa dang / khrel med pa dang lnga'o //
translated: Natural nonvirtue is the five nonvirtuous roots: attachment, aversion, delusion, shamelessness, and lack of conscience.

original: chos de lnga dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni ldan pa'i mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: chos de lnga dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni ldan pa'i mi dge ba'o //
translated: The nature of the mind and mental functions associated with these five dharmas is nonvirtue by association.🔽Nonvirtue by generation is the physical and verbal nonvirtue generated by a nonvirtuous mind.

original: mi dge ba dang ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung bas bskyed pa'i lus kyi sgo nas gzhan la brdeg pa dang / ngag gi sgo nas tshig rtsub mo smra ba la sogs pa ni bskyed pa'i mi dge ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba dang ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung bas bskyed pa'i lus kyi sgo nas gzhan la brdeg pa dang / ngag gi sgo nas tshig rtsub mo smra ba la sogs pa ni bskyed pa'i mi dge ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The nonvirtuous action that is generated is the physical action of striking another and the verbal action of harsh speech, etc., that are generated by a mind and mental factors that are nonvirtuous.

original: 'khor ba ni don dam par mi dge ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba ni don dam par mi dge ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Samsara is the ultimate nonvirtuous action.

original: lung du ma bstan pa yang rnam pa bzhi yod de /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa yang rnam pa bzhi yod de /
translated: There are four types of neutral action:

original: rang bzhin gyis lung du ma bstan pa dang / ldan pa'i lung du ma bstan pa dang / bskyed pa'i lung du ma bstan pa dang / don dam pa'i lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis lung du ma bstan pa dang / ldan pa'i lung du ma bstan pa dang / bskyed pa'i lung du ma bstan pa dang / don dam pa'i lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: the neutral action that is natural, the neutral action that is possessed, the neutral action that is generated, and the neutral action that is ultimate.

original: de la mig nas lus kyi bar du dbang po lnga dang / dri dang / @134b ro dang / reg bya ste /
analyzed: de la mig nas lus kyi bar du dbang po lnga dang / dri dang / @134b ro dang / reg bya ste /
translated: The five faculties from eye to body, and smell, taste, and tactility

original: chos brgyad rnams ni rang bzhin gyis lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos brgyad rnams ni rang bzhin gyis lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: are the eight natural neutral phenomena.

original: spyod lam dang bzo'i gnas la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni ldan pa'i lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: spyod lam dang bzo'i gnas la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni ldan pa'i lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: The minds and mental factors that are associated with the activities of daily behavior, the arts and crafts, etc., are called “associated neutral states.”

original: lung du ma bstan pa dang ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung bas bskyed pa'i lus kyi sgo nas tshem drub byed pa dang / ngag gi sgo nas tshem drub kyi gtam smra ba ni bskyed pa'i lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa dang ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung bas bskyed pa'i lus kyi sgo nas tshem drub byed pa dang / ngag gi sgo nas tshem drub kyi gtam smra ba ni bskyed pa'i lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The body and speech that are generated by the minds and mental factors that are associated with neutral states are called “generated neutral states.”

original: so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa dang nam mkha' ni don dam par lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa dang nam mkha' ni don dam par lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The cessation that is not achieved through a discriminating mental process and space are called “ultimate neutral states.”🔽Ten are of all three types.

original: bcu ni rnam pa gsum char te zhes bya ba la khams bco brgyad las khams bcu la ni gsum char gyi rang bzhin yod de /🔽bcu po de dag la dge ba yang yod /
analyzed: bcu ni rnam pa gsum char te zhes bya ba la khams bco brgyad las khams bcu la ni gsum char gyi rang bzhin yod de / bcu po de dag la dge ba yang yod /
translated: The ten elements that are of all three types are the five beginning with faith and the five beginning with form.

original: mi dge ba yang yod /
analyzed: mi dge ba yang yod /
translated: These ten elements are virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral.

original: lung du ma bstan pa yang yod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa yang yod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The five elements of mental objects are of all three types.

original: khams bco brgyad kyi nang nas bcu zhes bya ba gang la bya mi shes nas /
analyzed: khams bco brgyad kyi nang nas bcu zhes bya ba gang la bya mi shes nas /
translated: Since it is not known which of the eighteen elements are the ten,

original: de bas na bcu po gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na bcu po gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to demonstrate which are the ten,

original: sems kyi khams bdun dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / chos kyi khams rnams so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sems kyi khams bdun dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / chos kyi khams rnams so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it says: the seven mental elements, the form element, the sound element, and the entity element.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du sems kyi khams drug dang yid kyi khams kyis bsnan te bdun dang / gzugs kyi khams te brgyad sgra'i khams te dgu dang / chos kyi khams kyis bsnan te bcu la ni dge ba yang yod mi dge ba yang yod lung du ma bstan pa yang yod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du sems kyi khams drug dang yid kyi khams kyis bsnan te bdun dang / gzugs kyi khams te brgyad sgra'i khams te dgu dang / chos kyi khams kyis bsnan te bcu la ni dge ba yang yod mi dge ba yang yod lung du ma bstan pa yang yod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The seven mental elements are the six from the eye-consciousness element to the mind-consciousness element, plus the mind element. The form element is the eighth. The sound element is the ninth. The entity element is the tenth. The meaning is that there are virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral states.

original: de la je sems kyi khams bdun la rnam pa gsum ji ltar yod pa bstan te /
analyzed: de la je sems kyi khams bdun la rnam pa gsum ji ltar yod pa bstan te /
translated: Among those, the seven mental elements are demonstrated to have three aspects.

original: sems kyi khams bdun ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang ldan pa'i sgo nas dge ba dang mi dge bar gzhag gi dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems kyi khams bdun ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang ldan pa'i sgo nas dge ba dang mi dge bar gzhag gi dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
translated: The seven mental elements are posited as virtuous or nonvirtuous on the basis of being concomitant with virtue or nonvirtue, but they are not by nature virtuous or nonvirtuous.

original: de la 'dod ma chags pa la sogs pa'i dge ba dang ldan pa'i sems kyi khams bdun la ni dge ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod ma chags pa la sogs pa'i dge ba dang ldan pa'i sems kyi khams bdun la ni dge ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The seven mental elements that are concomitant with virtue such as nonattachment are called virtuous.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa mi dge ba dang ldan pa'i sems kyi khams bdun ni mi dge ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa mi dge ba dang ldan pa'i sems kyi khams bdun ni mi dge ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The seven mental elements that are concomitant with nonvirtue such as attachment are called nonvirtuous.

original: bzo la sogs pa'i las dang ldan pa'i sems kyi khams bdun ni lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya'o //🔽gzugs kyi khams dang / sgra'i khams la rnam pa gsum du gzhag pa yang dge ba lnga dang ldan pa'i sems kyis bskyed pa'i sangs rgyas la sogs @135a * //
analyzed: bzo la sogs pa'i las dang ldan pa'i sems kyi khams bdun ni lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya'o // gzugs kyi khams dang / sgra'i khams la rnam pa gsum du gzhag pa yang dge ba lnga dang ldan pa'i sems kyis bskyed pa'i sangs rgyas la sogs @135a * //
translated: The seven mental elements that are concomitant with karma such as crafts are called neutral.

original: pa la phyag 'tshal ba'i lus kyi las ni dge ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa la phyag 'tshal ba'i lus kyi las ni dge ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The form element and sound element are posited as threefold. The virtuous karma of body that is generated by the five virtuous minds such as the mind of faith that is concomitant with the five virtuous aggregates such as faith and so on, which is the body karma of prostration to the Buddha and so on, is called virtuous.

original: mi dge ba lnga dang ldan pa'i sems kyis bskyed pa'i gzhan la brdeg pa dang / sreg gcod pa la sogs pa'i lus kyi las ni mi dge ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba lnga dang ldan pa'i sems kyis bskyed pa'i gzhan la brdeg pa dang / sreg gcod pa la sogs pa'i lus kyi las ni mi dge ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The action of the body, such as striking, burning, and cutting, which is produced by a mind possessing the five non-virtues, is called non-virtuous.

original: spyod lam dang bzo'i gnas byed pa'i lus kyi las ni lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: spyod lam dang bzo'i gnas byed pa'i lus kyi las ni lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The action of the body, such as deportment and the arts, is called indeterminate.

original: sgra yang dge ba'i las kyis bskyed nas sangs rgyas la bstod pa la sogs pa smra ba ni dge ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sgra yang dge ba'i las kyis bskyed nas sangs rgyas la bstod pa la sogs pa smra ba ni dge ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Speech, such as praising the Buddha, which is produced by virtuous action, is called virtuous.

original: mi dge ba'i sems kyis bskyed pa'i gshe pa la sogs pa dag gi las la ni mi dge ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i sems kyis bskyed pa'i gshe pa la sogs pa dag gi las la ni mi dge ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The action of speech, such as scolding, which is produced by a non-virtuous mind, is called non-virtuous.

original: tha mal pa'i gtam dang bzo'i gtam smra ba la ni lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tha mal pa'i gtam dang bzo'i gtam smra ba la ni lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Speech, such as ordinary conversation and the arts, is called indeterminate.

original: chos kyi khams la rnam pa gsum du gzhag pa yang chos kyi khams tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang / 'dus ma byas bzhi ste brgyad yod pa las 'du byed kyi phung po la dge ba bcu gcig gi nang nas 'dod ma chags pa dang /
analyzed: chos kyi khams la rnam pa gsum du gzhag pa yang chos kyi khams tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang / 'dus ma byas bzhi ste brgyad yod pa las 'du byed kyi phung po la dge ba bcu gcig gi nang nas 'dod ma chags pa dang /
translated: The element of mental objects is also classified in three ways. The element of mental objects consists of eight: the element of mental objects that is feeling, the element of mental objects that is conception, the element of mental objects that is the karmic forces, the element of mental objects that is noninformative form, and the four that are unconditioned.

original: zhe mi sdang ba dang / gti mi mug pa dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa ni rang bzhin gyis dge ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhe mi sdang ba dang / gti mi mug pa dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa ni rang bzhin gyis dge ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Among the eleven virtuous karmic forces, nonattachment, nonhatred, and nonharmfulness are called “naturally virtuous.”

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dge ba dang ldan pa dang / brtson pa la sogs pa dge ba gzhan yod pa ni ldan pa'i dge ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dge ba dang ldan pa dang / brtson pa la sogs pa dge ba gzhan yod pa ni ldan pa'i dge ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Virtuous feeling and conception, and the other virtuous karmic forces such as effort, are called “virtuous by association.”

original: 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa skye ba dang / rga ba la sogs pa dge ba dang ldan pa'i sems kyis bskyed pa ni bskyed pa'i dge ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa skye ba dang / rga ba la sogs pa dge ba dang ldan pa'i sems kyis bskyed pa ni bskyed pa'i dge ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The karmic forces that are not associated with the mind, such as birth, aging, and so on, that are produced by a virtuous mind are called “virtuous by production.”

original: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa dang / de kho na nyid ni don dam pa'i dge ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa dang / de kho na nyid ni don dam pa'i dge ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The cessation resulting from deliberation and reality are called ultimately wholesome.

original: 'du byed kyi phung po la 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / ngo tsha mi shes pa dang / khrel med pa dang lnga ni rang bzhin gyis mi dge ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po la 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / ngo tsha mi shes pa dang / khrel med pa dang lnga ni rang bzhin gyis mi dge ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Five factors of the formation aggregate are called by nature unwholesome: attachment, aversion, conceit, ignorance, and lack of conscience and shame.

original: tshor ba dang 'du shes mi dge ba'i chos dang ldan pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba la sogs pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yod pa rnams ni ldan pa'i mi dge ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang 'du shes mi dge ba'i chos dang ldan pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba la sogs pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yod pa rnams ni ldan pa'i mi dge ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The feeling and perception aggregates that are associated with unwholesome factors and the secondary mental afflictions such as violence are called unwholesome through association.

original: mi dge ba'i sems kyis bskyed pa'i skye ba dang / rga ba la sogs pa'i 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa ni bskyed pa'i mi dge ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i sems kyis bskyed pa'i skye ba dang / rga ba la sogs pa'i 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa ni bskyed pa'i mi dge ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The formations that are not associated with the mind, such as birth, aging, etc., that are produced by an unwholesome mind are called unwholesome by motivation.

original: 'du byed kyi phung po la bzhi gzhan du yang zhes bya ba las lung du ma bstan pa'i char bshad pa @135b rnams ni ldan pa'i lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po la bzhi gzhan du yang zhes bya ba las lung du ma bstan pa'i char bshad pa @135b rnams ni ldan pa'i lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The four factors of the formation aggregate that are explained as being a part of the indeterminate in the verse that states, “Four are of two types” are called indeterminate through association.

original: so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa dang nam mkha' ni don dam par lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa dang nam mkha' ni don dam par lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Non-analytical cessation and space are said to be ultimately neutral.🔽The remaining eight are neutral.

original: lhag ma brgyad ni lung du ma bstan pa'o zhes bya ba khams bco brgyad kyi nang nas bcu rnam pa gsum char yin no zhes bstan pa yin no zhes bshad pa'i phyir lhag ma brgyad lus te /
analyzed: lhag ma brgyad ni lung du ma bstan pa'o zhes bya ba khams bco brgyad kyi nang nas bcu rnam pa gsum char yin no zhes bstan pa yin no zhes bshad pa'i phyir lhag ma brgyad lus te /
translated: The remaining eight are the eight elements that are exclusively neutral.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /

analyzed: dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi khams te brgyad do //

analyzed: nang zhes bya ba ni bdag gi lus su gtogs pa la bya'o //

analyzed: bcu gnyis te zhes bya ba ni khams bco brgyad las khams bcu gnyis ni nang gir zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: khams bco brgyad kyi nang nas bdun ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin no //

analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa gzhan med dam snyam pa la /

analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa ni sems kyi khams bdun du ma zad kyi /
translated: In order to demonstrate that not only the seven mental elements have objects,

analyzed: gzhan yang yod par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: but that there are others that have objects,

analyzed: chos kyi khams kyi rdzas brgyad yod pa las kun ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin gyi /

analyzed: de la phyogs gcig ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: don du na sems kyi khams bdun dang / chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig ni / dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In fact, seven elements of consciousness and one part of the element of mental objects🔽have an object.

analyzed: de la dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i zhes bya ba ni yul dang bcas spyod yul dang bcas zhes bya ba'i don to //

translated: Since it is not known which part of the element of mental objects has an object, in order to show that, he says,

original: gang sems las byung ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang sems las byung ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: that which is a mental factor.

original: chos kyi khams la cha gnyis su gzhag ste /
analyzed: chos kyi khams la cha gnyis su gzhag ste /
translated: The element of mental objects is posited as having two parts:

original: sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin dang / sems las byung ba ma yin pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin dang / sems las byung ba ma yin pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: that which is of the nature of a mental factor and that which is not of the nature of a mental factor.

original: de la tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed kyi phung po la 'du byed sems dang ldan pa lnga bcu rtsa gcig ni sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin zhes bya'o //

translated: Among them, the aggregate of feeling, the aggregate of perception, and the aggregate of formations consisting of fifty-one mental factors are called the nature of mental factors.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang / 'dus ma byas bzhi dang / 'du byed kyi phung po la 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa rnams ni sems las byung ba ma yin pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang / 'dus ma byas bzhi dang / 'du byed kyi phung po la 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa rnams ni sems las byung ba ma yin pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The aggregate of formations consisting of non-associated formative forces, the four unconditioned factors, and the aggregate of formations consisting of non-associated formative forces are not mental factors.

original: de la chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig sems las byung ba'i @136b rang bzhin rnams ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig sems las byung ba'i @136b rang bzhin rnams ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: Among them, the part of the element of mental objects that is the nature of mental factors is called that which has an object.

original: don du na mig gi rnam par shes pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar du sems kyi khams drug dang / yid kyi khams kyis bsnan te sems kyi khams bdun dang / chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin rnams ni dmigs pa dang bcas par bshad do //
analyzed: don du na mig gi rnam par shes pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar du sems kyi khams drug dang / yid kyi khams kyis bsnan te sems kyi khams bdun dang / chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin rnams ni dmigs pa dang bcas par bshad do //
translated: In fact, the six elements of consciousness, from the eye consciousness to the mind consciousness, the seven elements of consciousness by adding the mind element, and the part of the element of mental objects which is of the nature of mental factors are said to have an object.

original: dmigs pa med pa du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa du zhes bya ba la /
translated: How many have no object?

original: khams bco brgyad las dmigs pa med pa'i khams du zhig yod ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khams bco brgyad las dmigs pa med pa'i khams du zhig yod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: how many elements out of the eighteen elements have no object?

original: lhag ma bcu dang / chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig go zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lhag ma bcu dang / chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig go zhes bya ba la /
translated: Ten of them and one part of the element of mental objects.

original: khams bco brgyad las sems kyi khams bdun dang / chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin dmigs pa dang bcas par bshad pa'i lhag ma mig gi khams nas lus kyi khams kyi bar du dbang po lnga dang / gzugs kyi khams nas reg bya'i khams kyi bar du yul lnga ste bcu dang /
analyzed: khams bco brgyad las sems kyi khams bdun dang / chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin dmigs pa dang bcas par bshad pa'i lhag ma mig gi khams nas lus kyi khams kyi bar du dbang po lnga dang / gzugs kyi khams nas reg bya'i khams kyi bar du yul lnga ste bcu dang /
translated: From among the eighteen elements, seven mental elements and one part of the phenomena element are said to possess focal objects since they are by nature mental factors.🔽The remaining ten are the five sense faculties from the eye element to the body element and the five objects from the form element to the tactility element.

original: chos kyi khams las sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin dang / sems las byung ba ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gnyis yod pa las ni gang chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa thams cad dang /
analyzed: chos kyi khams las sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin dang / sems las byung ba ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gnyis yod pa las ni gang chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa thams cad dang /
translated: The phenomena element has two parts: that which is by nature a mental factor and that which is not by nature a mental factor.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang / 'dus ma byas bzhi ni dmigs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang / 'dus ma byas bzhi ni dmigs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is not by nature a mental factor is all nonassociated formative factors and the four unconditioned phenomena.

original: don du na sems dang sems las byung ba la ni dmigs pa'i yul yod par bshad kyi /
analyzed: don du na sems dang sems las byung ba la ni dmigs pa'i yul yod par bshad kyi /
translated: In fact, it is said that mind and mental factors have focal objects.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba ma yin pa rnams la ni /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba ma yin pa rnams la ni /
translated: But for those that are not mind or mental factors,

analyzed: dmigs pa'i yul med par bshad do //
translated: it is explained that there is no object of observation.

original: rtog pa dang bcas pa du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas pa du zhes bya ba la /
translated: How many are associated with conceptuality?

original: khams bco brgyad bshad pa'i skabs yin pas khams bco brgyad kyi nang nas rtog pa dang bcas pa'i khams du yong ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khams bco brgyad bshad pa'i skabs yin pas khams bco brgyad kyi nang nas rtog pa dang bcas pa'i khams du yong ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since this is the section on the explanation of the eighteen constituents, the meaning of the question is: How many of the eighteen constituents are constituents that are associated with conceptuality?

original: yid kyi khams dang ; yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig go zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yid kyi khams dang ; yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig go zhes bya ba la /
translated: The mental constituent, the mind consciousness constituent, and one part of the phenomena constituent.

original: khams bco brgyad kyi nang nas yid kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / chos kyi khams la cha gnyis te /
analyzed: khams bco brgyad kyi nang nas yid kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / chos kyi khams la cha gnyis te /
translated: From among the eighteen constituents, the mental constituent, the mind consciousness constituent, and two parts of the phenomena constituent

original: sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin @137a * //
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin @137a * //
translated: are the nature of mental factors.

original: dang ; sems las byung ba ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gnyis yod pa las /
analyzed: dang ; sems las byung ba ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gnyis yod pa las /
translated: And one part of the phenomena constituent is the nature of those that are not mental factors.

original: chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin rnams ni rtog pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin rnams ni rtog pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One part of the phenomena constituent that is the nature of mental factors is called “associated with conceptuality.”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yid kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig la /
analyzed: yid kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig la /
translated: Because the mind element, the mind consciousness element, and one part of the phenomena element

original: rtog pa dang bcas pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: are called “with investigation.”

original: 'di ltar rtog pa rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtog pa rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: There are three kinds of investigation:

original: rang bzhin gyis rtog pa dang / rjes su dran pa'i rtog pa dang / gtan la 'bebs pa'i rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rtog pa dang / rjes su dran pa'i rtog pa dang / gtan la 'bebs pa'i rtog pa'o //
translated: natural investigation, investigation as recollection, and investigation as determination.

original: de la rang bzhin gyis rtog pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pas gzugs la gzugs tsam du shes pa dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pas sgra la sgra tsam du shes pa'o //
analyzed: de la rang bzhin gyis rtog pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pas gzugs la gzugs tsam du shes pa dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pas sgra la sgra tsam du shes pa'o //
translated: Natural investigation is the eye consciousness knowing form as merely form, and the ear consciousness knowing sound as merely sound.

original: rjes su dran pa'i rtog pa ni sngon mthong ba dang / thos pa la sogs pa phyis ma brjed cing /
analyzed: rjes su dran pa'i rtog pa ni sngon mthong ba dang / thos pa la sogs pa phyis ma brjed cing /
translated: Investigation as recollection is not forgetting what was previously seen, heard, etc.,

original: dran pa ma nyams pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa ma nyams pa'o //
translated: and not losing the memory.

original: gtan la 'bebs pa'i rtog pa ni khams gsum dang dus gsum gyi dngos po rnams las kha cig mig gis mngon sum du mthong ba dang / kha cig mig gis mngon sum du mthong ba yang rna bas thos pa la sogs pa las shes rab dang sems pa'i khyad par gyis 'di ni yin 'di ni ma yin zhes rtog pa ni gtan la 'bebs pa'i rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gtan la 'bebs pa'i rtog pa ni khams gsum dang dus gsum gyi dngos po rnams las kha cig mig gis mngon sum du mthong ba dang / kha cig mig gis mngon sum du mthong ba yang rna bas thos pa la sogs pa las shes rab dang sems pa'i khyad par gyis 'di ni yin 'di ni ma yin zhes rtog pa ni gtan la 'bebs pa'i rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The determining conception is that which, with regard to things of the three realms and three times, determines some things to be so and some things to be not so, through the difference of wisdom and thought, some things being seen directly by the eye and some things not being seen directly by the eye but being heard by the ear, and so on.🔽Therefore, the Abhidharma treatise called the Compendium of Higher Knowledge says:

original: de bas na mngon pa'i chos bsdus pa'i gtsug lag las kyang rjes su dran pa'i rtog pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na mngon pa'i chos bsdus pa'i gtsug lag las kyang rjes su dran pa'i rtog pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the conception of recollection?

original: sngon rjes su myong ba'i 'du byed rnams 'dzin pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sngon rjes su myong ba'i 'du byed rnams 'dzin pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the retention of the formative forces that have been previously experienced.

original: gtan la 'bebs pa'i rtog pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gtan la 'bebs pa'i rtog pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the determining conception?

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba rnams la mngon sum du ma gyur par rtog pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba rnams la mngon sum du ma gyur par rtog pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is the conception that conceives of things that have passed, that will come, and that are present, without directly perceiving them.

original: de la khri rkang pa gcig yod kyang gsum med na khri rkang pa med pa zhes bya ba dang 'dra bar rang bzhin gyis rnam par rtog pa yod kyang rjes su dran pa'i rtog pa dang / gtan la 'bebs pa'i rtog pa gnyis med na rnam par mi rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la khri rkang pa gcig yod kyang gsum med na khri rkang pa med pa zhes bya ba dang 'dra bar rang bzhin gyis rnam par rtog pa yod kyang rjes su dran pa'i rtog pa dang / gtan la 'bebs pa'i rtog pa gnyis med na rnam par mi rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Just as when there is one leg of a tripod but not three, it is called “no legs,” so too, although there is intrinsic discursiveness, if there is no dualistic discursiveness and no determining discursiveness, it is called “non-discursive.”

original: de bas na yid kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin rnams ni rjes su dran pa'i @137b rtog pa dang / gtan la 'bebs pa'i rtog pa gnyis dang ldan pas rtog pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na yid kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin rnams ni rjes su dran pa'i @137b rtog pa dang / gtan la 'bebs pa'i rtog pa gnyis dang ldan pas rtog pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the mental element, the mind consciousness element, and the part of the element of mental objects that is of the nature of mental factors are called “discursive” because they are associated with the two kinds of discursiveness: the discursiveness of memory and the discursiveness of determining.

original: gzhung las ma smos kyang khams lhag ma rnams ni rnam par mi rtog par grub ste /
analyzed: gzhung las ma smos kyang khams lhag ma rnams ni rnam par mi rtog par grub ste /
translated: Although it is not mentioned in the text, the remaining elements are established as non-discursive.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: mig gi khams nas lus kyi khams kyi bar du dbang po lnga dang / gzugs dang reg bya'i bar du yul lnga dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du lnga ste /
analyzed: mig gi khams nas lus kyi khams kyi bar du dbang po lnga dang / gzugs dang reg bya'i bar du yul lnga dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du lnga ste /
translated: The five faculties from the eye element to the body element, the five objects from form to tactility, and the five from the eye consciousness element to the body consciousness element.

original: bco lnga dang / chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig sems las byung ba ma yin pa rnams ni rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du gzhag go//
analyzed: bco lnga dang / chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig sems las byung ba ma yin pa rnams ni rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du gzhag go//
translated: The fifteen and one part of the phenomena element, which is not a derivative of the elements, are posited as nonconceptual.

original: zin pa du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zin pa du zhes bya ba la /
translated: How many are appropriated?

original: khams bco brgyad bshad pa'i skabs yin pas khams bco brgyad kyi nang nas zin pa'i khams ni du zhig yod ces bya ba'i don to //🔽de la sems dang sems las byung ba dang 'brel pa'am /
analyzed: khams bco brgyad bshad pa'i skabs yin pas khams bco brgyad kyi nang nas zin pa'i khams ni du zhig yod ces bya ba'i don to // de la sems dang sems las byung ba dang 'brel pa'am /
translated: Since this is the section on the eighteen elements, the question is how many of the eighteen elements are appropriated.

original: sems dang sems las byung bas zin pa'i gzugs la zin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung bas zin pa'i gzugs la zin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is related to the mind and mental factors or that which is conjoined with the mind and mental factors is called appropriated.

original: nang gi lnga dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nang gi lnga dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The five internal ones.

original: nang gi dbang po lnga ni zin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nang gi dbang po lnga ni zin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The five internal faculties are called appropriated.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: mig gi khams dang / rna ba'i khams dang / sna'i khams dang / lce'i khams dang / lus kyi khams so //
analyzed: mig gi khams dang / rna ba'i khams dang / sna'i khams dang / lce'i khams dang / lus kyi khams so //
translated: the ear element, the nose element, the tongue element, and the body element.

original: ci'i phyir mig la sogs pa'i lnga nyi tshe la zin pa zhes bya bar zad kyi zin pa gzhan yang med snyam pa la yod par bstan pa'i phyir /🔽bzhi'i phyogs te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mig la sogs pa'i lnga nyi tshe la zin pa zhes bya bar zad kyi zin pa gzhan yang med snyam pa la yod par bstan pa'i phyir / bzhi'i phyogs te /
translated: Why are only the five beginning with the eye called appropriated?

original: gzugs dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams kyi'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gzugs dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams kyi'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The four directions of form, smell, taste, and tactility.

original: 'di ltar gzugs dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya ste bzhi po de rnams la rnam pa gnyis yod de zin pa dang ma zin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya ste bzhi po de rnams la rnam pa gnyis yod de zin pa dang ma zin pa'o //
translated: Thus, the four beginning with form, smell, taste, and tactility have two aspects: appropriated and unappropriated.

original: de la gzugs dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya zin pa'i phyogs gang yin pa ni zin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la gzugs dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya zin pa'i phyogs gang yin pa ni zin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Among them, the appropriated part of form, smell, taste, and tactility is called appropriated.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: mig la sogs ba'i dbang po dang / tha mi dad cing mig la sogs pa'i dbang po dang / lhan cig tu gnas pa'i gzugs dang ; dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams dbang po sems dang / sems las byung ba zin pa bzhin du /
analyzed: mig la sogs ba'i dbang po dang / tha mi dad cing mig la sogs pa'i dbang po dang / lhan cig tu gnas pa'i gzugs dang ; dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams dbang po sems dang / sems las byung ba zin pa bzhin du /
translated: The form, smell, taste, and tangible objects that are not different from the faculties such as the eye, and that exist together with the faculties such as the eye, are called appropriated because they are grasped by the mind and mental factors, just as the faculties are.

original: dbang po la yod pa'i bzhi po'i phyogs de dag kyang sems dang sems las byung bas gzung bas na zin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po la yod pa'i bzhi po'i phyogs de dag kyang sems dang sems las byung bas gzung bas na zin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The part of the four that exists in the faculties is also called appropriated because it is grasped by the mind and mental factors.

original: 'di ltar lus la yod pa'i gzugs la sogs pa yang @138a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar lus la yod pa'i gzugs la sogs pa yang @138a * //
translated: In this way, the form and so on that exist in the body🔽are called appropriated because they are grasped by the mind and mental factors, just as the faculties are.

original: skra dang / spu dang / sen mo dang / so'i rtsa ba ma gtogs pa gzhan skra dang / spu dang / sen mo dang / bshad ba dang / gci ba dang / mchil ma dang / snabs dang / khrag la sogs pa ni ma zin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skra dang / spu dang / sen mo dang / so'i rtsa ba ma gtogs pa gzhan skra dang / spu dang / sen mo dang / bshad ba dang / gci ba dang / mchil ma dang / snabs dang / khrag la sogs pa ni ma zin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The other form and so on that exist in the body, except for the hair of the body, body hair, nails, and teeth, are called unappropriated because they are not grasped by the mind and mental factors, just as the hair of the head and so on are not.

original: zin pa zhes bya ba'i don ji lta bur sems dang sems las byung bas 'di ni bdag gi yul sa yin no zhes bya ba'i tshul du bzung la /
analyzed: zin pa zhes bya ba'i don ji lta bur sems dang sems las byung bas 'di ni bdag gi yul sa yin no zhes bya ba'i tshul du bzung la /
translated: The meaning of appropriated is that the mind and mental factors grasp them in the manner of thinking, this is my domain.

original: lus dang sems gnyis kyang gcig la gcig phan pa dang / gnod pas rjes su 'brel bar byed de /
analyzed: lus dang sems gnyis kyang gcig la gcig phan pa dang / gnod pas rjes su 'brel bar byed de /
translated: The body and mind are mutually related, because they are helpful to each other and harmful to each other.

original: lus la phan na yang sems la phan pa dang / sems la phan na yang lus la phan pa dang / lus la gnod na yang sems la gnod pa dang / sems la gnod na yang lus la gnod par byed pa ni zin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus la phan na yang sems la phan pa dang / sems la phan na yang lus la phan pa dang / lus la gnod na yang sems la gnod pa dang / sems la gnod na yang lus la gnod par byed pa ni zin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When the body is helped, the mind is helped; when the mind is helped, the body is helped. When the body is harmed, the mind is harmed; when the mind is harmed, the body is harmed. This is called “appropriated”.

original: ma zin pa du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ma zin pa du zhes bya ba la /
translated: How many are not appropriated?

original: khams bco brgyad kyi nang nas ma zin pa'i khams du yod ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khams bco brgyad kyi nang nas ma zin pa'i khams du yod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: how many of the eighteen elements are not appropriated?

original: lhag ma dgu dang bzhi po'i phyogs so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lhag ma dgu dang bzhi po'i phyogs so zhes bya ba la /
translated: The remainder of the nine and four parts.

original: dbang po lnga dang lhan cig 'grogs pa'i gzugs dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams zin par bshad pa'i lhag ma ni sems kyi khams bdun dang / chos kyi khams dang / sgra'i khams te dgu yang ma zin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po lnga dang lhan cig 'grogs pa'i gzugs dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams zin par bshad pa'i lhag ma ni sems kyi khams bdun dang / chos kyi khams dang / sgra'i khams te dgu yang ma zin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The form, smell, taste, and tactile objects that accompany the five faculties are explained as appropriated. The remainder of the seven mental elements, the element of mental objects, and the element of sound are also called “not appropriated”.

original: bzhi'i phyogs te ;
analyzed: bzhi'i phyogs te ;
translated: The four parts.

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga dang / tha mi dad par gnas pa ma yin pa'i gzugs dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i phyogs kyang ma zin zhes bya la /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga dang / tha mi dad par gnas pa ma yin pa'i gzugs dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i phyogs kyang ma zin zhes bya la /
translated: The five faculties of eye, etc., are not included in the category of form, smell, taste, and tactile sensations that are not distinct from the faculties.

original: rtsa ba las ma gtogs pa'i skra dang / spu dang / sen mo dang / so dang / bshad ba dang / gci ba dang / mchil ma dang / snabs dang / khrag la sogs pa ni ma zin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba las ma gtogs pa'i skra dang / spu dang / sen mo dang / so dang / bshad ba dang / gci ba dang / mchil ma dang / snabs dang / khrag la sogs pa ni ma zin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Hair, body hair, nails, teeth, skin, feces, urine, saliva, mucus, blood, etc., which are not included in the fundamental material elements, are called “not conjoined.”

original: cha mtshungs pa du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: cha mtshungs pa du zhes bya ba la /
translated: How many are homogeneous?

original: rnam par shes pa dang dbang po lhan cig tu 'grogs pa las dbang po rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i rgyu byed pa la ni cha mtshungs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang dbang po lhan cig tu 'grogs pa las dbang po rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i rgyu byed pa la ni cha mtshungs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That which is a cause for the production of a consciousness of a faculty through the association of a consciousness with a faculty is called “homogeneous.”

original: khams bco brgyad bshad pa'i skabs yin pas khams bco brgyad kyi nang nas cha mtshungs pa'i khams du yod ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khams bco brgyad bshad pa'i skabs yin pas khams bco brgyad kyi nang nas cha mtshungs pa'i khams du yod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since this is the context of the eighteen elements, the meaning is: How many of the eighteen elements are homogeneous?

original: nang gi gzugs can lnga ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nang gi gzugs can lnga ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Five internal form elements.

original: nang gi gzugs can gyi khams lnga ni cha mtshungs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nang gi gzugs can gyi khams lnga ni cha mtshungs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The five internal elements that have form are called homogeneous.

original: de la nang gi khams ni bcu gnyis su bshad de /
analyzed: de la nang gi khams ni bcu gnyis su bshad de /
translated: Among them, the internal elements are explained as twelve.

original: mig @138b gi khams nas yid kyi khams kyi bar du drug dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar du drug ste /
analyzed: mig @138b gi khams nas yid kyi khams kyi bar du drug dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar du drug ste /
translated: The six from the eye element up to the mind element, and the six from the eye consciousness element up to the mind consciousness element.

original: nang gi lnga po gang la bya mi shes te /
analyzed: nang gi lnga po gang la bya mi shes te /
translated: It is not known which five internal ones are meant.

original: de bas na bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach,

original: gzugs can zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gzugs can zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it says “having form.”

original: 'di ltar nang gi dbang po ni mig dang ; rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi khams dang lnga ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar nang gi dbang po ni mig dang ; rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi khams dang lnga ste /
translated: Thus, the internal faculties are the five elements of eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body.

original: de lnga ni cha mtshungs ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lnga ni cha mtshungs ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Those five are called homogeneous.🔽If it is not known what is homogeneous with what, and what is meant by “homogeneous,” in order to teach,

original: chos gang dang cha mtshungs pa dang / cha mtshungs pa zhes bya ba'i don ji lta bu yin pa mi shes nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chos gang dang cha mtshungs pa dang / cha mtshungs pa zhes bya ba'i don ji lta bu yin pa mi shes nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: it says:

original: rang gi rnam par shes pa dag yul dang mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rang gi rnam par shes pa dag yul dang mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because their consciousnesses are similar to their objects.

original: mig gi khams kyi rang gi rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: mig gi khams kyi rang gi rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The eye element’s own consciousness is eye consciousness.

original: mig gi dbang po'i yul gzugs yin pa de nyid rnam par shes pa'i yul yang gzugs de nyid yin te /
analyzed: mig gi dbang po'i yul gzugs yin pa de nyid rnam par shes pa'i yul yang gzugs de nyid yin te /
translated: The object of the eye faculty is form, and that very form is the object of consciousness.

original: mig gi dbang po dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa gzugs la mtshungs par 'jug pa ni /
analyzed: mig gi dbang po dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa gzugs la mtshungs par 'jug pa ni /
translated: The eye faculty and eye consciousness engage form similarly.

original: cha mtshungs pa zhes bya'o //🔽yang na mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yul gzugs yin pa bzhin du dbang po'i yul yang gzugs yin par cha mtshungs te /
analyzed: cha mtshungs pa zhes bya'o // yang na mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yul gzugs yin pa bzhin du dbang po'i yul yang gzugs yin par cha mtshungs te /
translated: This is called “similarity of part.”🔽Or, the object of the eye faculty is form, and the object of the eye consciousness is form. They are similar in that they are the same object.

original: ji ltar gzugs kyis mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i rgyu byed pa bzhin du mig gi dbang pos kyang mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i rgyu byed de /
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs kyis mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i rgyu byed pa bzhin du mig gi dbang pos kyang mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i rgyu byed de /
translated: Just as form acts as the cause that generates eye consciousness, the eye faculty also acts as the cause that generates eye consciousness.

original: gzugs dang mig gi dbang po gnyi ga mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba dang rjes su mthun par gnas pa ni cha mtshungs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang mig gi dbang po gnyi ga mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba dang rjes su mthun par gnas pa ni cha mtshungs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The eye and form both remain in conformity with the arising of eye consciousness. This is called “similarity of part.”

original: don du mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams mig gi rnam par shes pa dang 'grogs shing ldan pa'i tshe na cha mtshungs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don du mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams mig gi rnam par shes pa dang 'grogs shing ldan pa'i tshe na cha mtshungs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: In terms of meaning, when the eye and so on are associated with and possess eye consciousness, they are called “similarity of part.”

original: de dang mtshungs pa du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dang mtshungs pa du zhes bya ba la /
translated: How many are similar to that?

original: rnam par shes pa dang mi ldan pa'i dbang po rnams la de dang mtshungs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang mi ldan pa'i dbang po rnams la de dang mtshungs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The faculties that are not associated with consciousness are called “similar to that.”

original: khams bco brgyad kyi nang nas de dang mtshungs pa'i khams du yod ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khams bco brgyad kyi nang nas de dang mtshungs pa'i khams du yod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: how many of the eighteen elements are similar to that?

original: de dang mtshungs pa zhes bya ba ji lta bu yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dang mtshungs pa zhes bya ba ji lta bu yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate what is called “similar to that,”

original: de nyid rnam par shes pas stong pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid rnam par shes pas stong pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, “that itself is empty of consciousness.”

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po de dag nyid nam mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pas stong ste /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po de dag nyid nam mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pas stong ste /
translated: Those faculties such as the eye are themselves empty of eye consciousness and so on.

original: dbang po de dag gis rang gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i rgyu mi byed cing brgyal ba dang nyal ba la sogs pa'i dus na dbang po 'ba' zhig yod pa de dang mtshungs pa zhes bya'o //🔽rang gi rnam par shes @139a * //
analyzed: dbang po de dag gis rang gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i rgyu mi byed cing brgyal ba dang nyal ba la sogs pa'i dus na dbang po 'ba' zhig yod pa de dang mtshungs pa zhes bya'o // rang gi rnam par shes @139a * //
translated: Those faculties that do not function as causes to generate their own consciousnesses are called “similar to those that exist” when one is unconscious or asleep, and only the faculties exist.

original: pas stong pa'i dbang po de dag la ci'i phyir de dang mtshungs pa bya zhe na /
analyzed: pas stong pa'i dbang po de dag la ci'i phyir de dang mtshungs pa bya zhe na /
translated: Why are those faculties empty of their own consciousnesses called “similar to those that exist”?

original: de'i phyir / rang gi rigs dang mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / rang gi rigs dang mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, “because they are similar to their own type.”

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rang gi rnam par shes pas stong pa de dag mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rang gi rnam par shes pas stong pa gzhan dag dang / rigs mthun pas de dang mthun pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rang gi rnam par shes pas stong pa de dag mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rang gi rnam par shes pas stong pa gzhan dag dang / rigs mthun pas de dang mthun pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those faculties such as the eyes that are empty of their own consciousnesses are similar to other faculties such as the eyes that are empty of their own consciousnesses, because they are of the same type.

original: yang na rang gi rnam par shes pas stong pa'i mig la sogs pa'i dbang po de dag rang gi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa'i mig la sogs pa'i dbang po dang mig gi dbang por gnyi ga rigs 'dra bas na de dang mtshungs pa zhes bya ste
analyzed: yang na rang gi rnam par shes pas stong pa'i mig la sogs pa'i dbang po de dag rang gi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa'i mig la sogs pa'i dbang po dang mig gi dbang por gnyi ga rigs 'dra bas na de dang mtshungs pa zhes bya ste
translated: Or, the sense faculties such as the eye that are empty of eye consciousness are similar to the sense faculties such as the eye that possess eye consciousness because both are similar in type.

original: / nam lha sbyin gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa dang / nam lha sbyin gyi mig gi dbang pos mig gi rnam par shes pa mi skyed pa'i mig gnyi ga yang mig gi dbang por rigs 'dra bas na de dang mtshungs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: / nam lha sbyin gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa dang / nam lha sbyin gyi mig gi dbang pos mig gi rnam par shes pa mi skyed pa'i mig gnyi ga yang mig gi dbang por rigs 'dra bas na de dang mtshungs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When Devadatta’s eye generates eye consciousness and when Devadatta’s eye faculty does not generate eye consciousness, both eyes are similar in type because they are eye sense faculties.

original: mig gi dbang po mig gi rnam par shes pas stong ste de dang mtshungs pa gnyi ga yang /
analyzed: mig gi dbang po mig gi rnam par shes pas stong ste de dang mtshungs pa gnyi ga yang /
translated: The eye sense faculty is empty of eye consciousness. Both are similar in that

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu byed pas na /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu byed pas na /
translated: they are the uncommon cause that generates eye consciousness.

original: cha mtshungs pa dang mtshungs pa zhes bya'i /
analyzed: cha mtshungs pa dang mtshungs pa zhes bya'i /
translated: Therefore they are called similar in part and similar.

original: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i yul ni mtshungs pa dang de dang mtshungs pa zhes mi bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i yul ni mtshungs pa dang de dang mtshungs pa zhes mi bya ste /
translated: Objects such as form and sound are not called similar or similar to that.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: nam gzugs des lha sbyin gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i rgyu byed pas cha mtshungs pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: nam gzugs des lha sbyin gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i rgyu byed pas cha mtshungs pa zhes bya la /
translated: Because when form acts as the cause generating Devadatta's eye consciousness, it is called similar to that.

original: de nyid kyi dus na mchod sbyin gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pas de dang cha mtshungs par 'gyur bas na /🔽dus gcig tu cha mtshungs pa dang / de dang mtshungs pa gnyis su 'gyur ba'i phyir cha mtshungs pa zhe'am /
analyzed: de nyid kyi dus na mchod sbyin gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pas de dang cha mtshungs par 'gyur bas na / dus gcig tu cha mtshungs pa dang / de dang mtshungs pa gnyis su 'gyur ba'i phyir cha mtshungs pa zhe'am /
translated: At that time, it also generates Yajña's eye consciousness, so it becomes similar to that.

original: de dang mtshungs pa zhes gzhag tu med la /
analyzed: de dang mtshungs pa zhes gzhag tu med la /
translated: Therefore, it cannot be posited as either similar to that or similar to that at the same time.

original: gzugs la sogs pa ni lha sbyin gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa bzhin du mchod sbyin gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa yang skyed pas thun mong du gyur pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ni lha sbyin gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa bzhin du mchod sbyin gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa yang skyed pas thun mong du gyur pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because form and so on are common to both Devadatta and Yajña, since they generate Yajña's eye consciousness just as they generate Devadatta's eye consciousness,

original: de dang cha mtshungs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dang cha mtshungs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: they are called similar to that.

original: phung po lnga bshad pa slob dpon sa'i rtsa lag gis mdzad pa rdzogs sho /
analyzed: phung po lnga bshad pa slob dpon sa'i rtsa lag gis mdzad pa rdzogs sho /
translated: The explanation of the five aggregates composed by Master Pṛthivībandhu is complete.

original: // / rgya gar mkhan po dzi na mi tra dang / d'a na sh'i la dang / bod kyi lo ts'a ba ban de ye shes sde la sogs pas bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o /
analyzed: // / rgya gar mkhan po dzi na mi tra dang / d'a na sh'i la dang / bod kyi lo ts'a ba ban de ye shes sde la sogs pas bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o /
translated: The Indian preceptors Jinamitra and Dānaśīla, and the Tibetan translator-monk Yeshé Dé and others translated, revised, and finalized this text.
